website_summaries.verdict: A higher end gas cooktop that has 5 burners and a locking feature for safety.
pros: This cooktop has a large center burner (18,000BTUs) that is designed for larger pots while the smallest burner (5,000 BTUs) is effective for keeping food warm
The durable cast iron grates and rapid burner technology are appreciated
cons: The stainless steel surface of this cooktop can be difficult to keep clean from smudges, fingerprints, and splatters

customer_reviews.title: The best gas cooktop I have used so far
customer_reviews.text: I have used two gas cooktops that are from different manufacture. This gas cooktop (GE PGP9030SLSS 30 Inch Gas Cooktop) is the best. I thought gas cooktops were more or less the same regardless of who manufactured them, it was just transferring gas plus oxygen. After purchase this gas cooktop, I realized my thought was so wrong. Apparently GE knows that how gas cooktop works and knows how to build it. This is the best purchase I made.

customer_reviews.title: Cleaning
customer_reviews.text: Love this cooktop. If we had room for the 36 in model, we would have bought that one. Only reason I gave 4 instead of 5 stars was because it is difficult to clean. Seems no matter what you cook on it, splatter gets down on the stainless surface around the burners necessitating the complete removal of the heave cast iron grates to clean the stainless under it. Would be nice to redesign it for easier cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Gerrit Mayer

customer_reviews.title: Love the look and it performs great!
customer_reviews.text: A little on the expensive side but a very nice stainless finish and looks very nice in our kitchen. Works great and goes nicely with our other GE appliances. Purchased the copper knobs separately and it really sets off the cooktop. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stainless Discolors
customer_reviews.text: After using this for several weeks and just cleaning top with soap and water. The stovetop has discolored in several areas. I even tried using Stainless steel cleaner to see if it would remove the discoloration and it did not work. Very unhappy with this product
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great strong burner
customer_reviews.text: That center burner is great... Much stronger than anything else I've seen in particular in this price range. It is tough to clean being stainless steel, but that is true for all stainless steel appliances.
customer_reviews.author: Chris vH

customer_reviews.title: GREZT unit
customer_reviews.text: Ed excellent cooktop cut off valve for gas is a must for pet owners
customer_reviews.author: Patrick  Butler

customer_reviews.title: No,no,no
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as expected, so far. Believe the more I use I will adjust. The knobs are tooo close to the pans
customer_reviews.author: OncDoc

customer_reviews.title: Love this cooktop
customer_reviews.text: Love this cooktop! Some reviews say the knobs melt. If you cover knobs while cooking there will be a problem on any cooktop!! This is a beautiful, quality item.
customer_reviews.author: Kattluv

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Great gas stove. This made a huge addition to our kitchen. Love the safety feature also.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Price

customer_reviews.title: Have it professionaly installed!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Wife is very pleased with looks & ease of use!
customer_reviews.author: Craig Deans

customer_reviews.title: Great cooktop
customer_reviews.text: Is easy to install and works great, good flame and easy to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Gato

customer_reviews.title: Poorly built
customer_reviews.text: One of the knobs melted within the first few uses.
customer_reviews.author: Mman

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking, works well, knobs melt
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an older GE gas cooktop with this one. It is very nice looking and works well -- love the middle burner for boiling a big pot of water for pasta -- and easier to clean than the older one. However, the knobs are higher than the burner grates, and if you put something hot down on the grate and it touches a knob, the knob melts. My older cooktop had shorter knobs and this never happened in 20 years.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hubachek
